active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the scenarios where grey box testing is preferable to black box or white box testing. Consider trade-offs in realism (simulating insider threats), cost (reduced reconnaissance time), and coverage (targeted vs. exhaustive). Provide real-world examples, such as testing an e-commerce site with shared admin credentials.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Penetration Testing and Ethical Hacking. Generate high-quality, Anki-optimized flashcards for the topic 'Partial Knowledge Assessment (Grey Box Testing)' in the hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Penetration Testing Types > 002_Knowledge-Based Testing Approaches > Grey Box Testing > Partial Knowledge Assessment. **Core Content Integration:** Use the provided scaffolding layers, definitions (grey box: partial knowledge like creds/diagrams; contrasts black/white box), PTES phases, OWASP WSTG (authenticated web testing), tools (Nmap/Burp), hands-on scenarios (e-commerce with creds), and sources (PTES: http://www.pentest-standard.org/; OWASP: https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/; NIST 800-115). **Pedagogical Alignment:** - Learning Objectives: [Insert the 6 objectives from above]. - Active Learning: Tie flashcards to discussion (trade-offs), peer teaching (PTES scenarios), problem-solving (attack paths). - Scaffolding: Distribute evenly across 4 layers. - Bloom's Coverage: Balanced across levels. **Output Format:** JSON array of 25 flashcards. Each: {"front": "Question", "back": {"answer": "...", "explanation": "... (cite source, link to objective/layer/activity)", "bloom_level": "REMEMBER", "scaffolding_layer": 1, "type": "MCQ"}}. For MCQs: Front includes options A-D; distractors per protocol. **Best Practices:** Questions active/recall-focused. Explanations scaffolded (build from foundation). Distractors plausible/misconception-based. Ensure measurable, verifiable content. Prioritize voter consensus: completeness (full sources), pedagogy (measurable objectives), hands-on (tools/procedures).
